=== [[Talk:Ilhan Omar#rfc_1039151|Talk:Ilhan Omar]] expired 2021-06-12 09:01 ===
* Id: 1039151
* User: Benevolent human
* Date: 2021-06-12 02:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1028136650|BIO 1028136650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1028169579|BIO 1028169579}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We have reached a consensus here that information should go in the article to the degree that mainstream reliable sources cover it, per policy. We disputed whether to include Omar's stereotyping of American Jews in the lead on the basis that it was a news story that may have been given short-lived coverage, but we now have continuing coverage of these events over a year later:
* "Omar‚Äôs tweet is the latest among her frequent criticisms of the Israeli government that drew ire from lawmakers of both parties who have condemned them as perpetuating antisemitic stereotypes." - Washington Post [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/jewish-democrats-omar-israel/2021/06/10/45d5db22-c9e9-11eb-a11b-6c6191ccd599_story.html]
* "Her Twitter comment in 2019 that support in Washington for Israel was ‚Äúall about the Benjamins baby‚Äù kicked off weeks of fighting that ended in a resolution on the House floor condemning bigotry and anti-Semitism. The comments played into anti-Semitic tropes that have roots in the Middle Ages, when Jews were barred from entering most professions and thus became moneylenders ‚Äî a task that Christians would not take on because of prohibitions against usury." [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/10/us/politics/ilhan-omar-israel.html]

Per [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Index/Palestine-Israel_articles#ARBPIA_General_Sanctions|5.b.1 of ARBPIA]], I am therefore opening a new RFC whether, in light of this new information, some mention of criticism of Omar's alleged stereotyping of American Jews unaffiliated with Israel should be mentioned in the lead. [[User:Benevolent human|Benevolent human]] ([[User talk:Benevolent human|talk]]) 02:25, 12 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Largest cities#rfc_FC1A4A5|Template talk:Largest cities]] expired 2021-06-12 13:01 ===
* Id: FC1A4A5
* User: Catchpoke
* Date: 2021-06-12 03:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1028141691|UNSORTED 1028141691}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1028194886|UNSORTED 1028194886}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3AWhatLinksHere&target=Template%3ALargest+cities&namespace=0 In article space], this template is used in numerous city articles but in a recent [[Wikipedia:Templates for discussion/Log/2021 May 17#Template:Largest cities of Israel|template discussion]], it was determined that there is no policy which states national level templates should be kept.

The policy relevant here is [[WP:NAVCOLOR]] and that would mean that this template and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3AWhatLinksHere&target=Template%3ALargest+cities&namespace=10 templates that implement it] would need to be deprecated and deleted.

[[WP:NAVCOLOR]] is applicable here because the design is arbitrary and capricious.  This is due to the fact that this template gives options to list either 10 or 20 city entries and either 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 pictures of cities and these options prevent the internal dimensions of the template from staying consistent. [[User:Catchpoke|Catchpoke]] ([[User talk:Catchpoke|talk]]) 03:20, 12 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Upload (company)#rfc_48DC051|Talk:Upload (company)]] expired 2021-06-12 20:01 ===
* Id: 48DC051
* User: Jaxarnolds
* Date: 2021-05-27 02:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1025346772|HIST 1025346772}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1026579570|ECON 1026579570}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1028249548|ECON 1028249548}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1028249552|HIST 1028249552}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the UploadVR be changed from Defunct to Operating?  
Background: The company operated 2 businesses before:  1) A media website at uploadvr.com 2) Workspaces located in LA and SF. The company shut down it's workspaces. Leases were transferred to new entities. The company re-organized under a new name UVR MEDIA, LLC and still operates uploadvr.com. Here is a supporting article [https://disruptglobal.io/the-uploadvr-lawsuit-media-men-list-and-tragic-unintended-impacts-of-metoo-in-media-and-tech/ this article]. It states: ''"Half a year later, UploadVR laid off their LA and SF coworking staff and transitioned the spaces to new operators, The Riveter and Starfish respectively, who continued to house their VR, AR and AI focused tenants. UVR Media LLC was formed and UploadVR continued to expand its existing platform of news and content. Even though the company was ultimately able to recover and reclaim its position in the media space, the whole thing dealt them a huge blow and destroyed much of what they had created to support the early VR and AR community."''

:It is also quiet aparant from the website that is still operating. I am asking that the first sentence be changed so that it says "UploadVR (formerly UploadVR, Inc. and Upload Inc.) is an American virtual reality-focused technology..."
:Also, the Infobox needs to be udpated and Defunct status removed.
:Thanks.[[User:Jaxarnolds|Jaxarnolds]] ([[User talk:Jaxarnolds|talk]]) 02:56, 27 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_8759605|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2021-06-14 19:01 ===
* Id: 8759605
* User: Sungodtemple
* Date: 2021-05-22 14:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1024506262|PROP 1024506262}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1029706482|PROP 1029706482}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are many [[WP:AUTOCONFIRMED|autoconfirmed]] editors who have no idea that their article is not ready for mainspace. The [[Special:Tags|tag]] <code>#new user moving page out of userspace</code> is quite a good example of this. If you surf through the list of articles at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChanges?hidebots=1&hidecategorization=1&hideWikibase=1&tagfilter=de-userfying&limit=50&days=7&urlversion=2 you will see many articles that could definitely be [[WP:SPEEDYDELETE|speedy deleted]] and others that just need to be improved more. And of course, there is some legitimate minor page moves like [[Special:Diff/1011516087|this move per WP:ENDASH]]. So here are the options I came up with:

#'''Status quo.''' Automatically mark moves as minor.
#'''Optional.''' Leave the option to mark moves as minor or major.
#'''Required.''' All page moves are marked as major.

Yes, this is not a major issue, but I had to bring it up anyways for the editors that ''do'' hide minor edits. [[User:Sungodtemple|Sungodtemple]] ([[User talk:Sungodtemple|talk]]) 14:40, 22 May 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Ilhan Omar#rfc_039B634|Talk:Ilhan Omar]] expired 2021-06-15 05:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
Should ARBPIA apply to allegations of whether Ilhan Omar invoked [[Antisemitic canard|anti-Semitic canards]] when discussing Jewish Americans?

* '''Oppose''' The controversy stems from Ilhan Omar allegedly saying that Jewish Americans who support Israel have dual loyalty to the US and Israel. Dual loyalty implies people are doing nice things for Israel since they're loyal to israel, but the US has, in part due to AIPAC and other pro-Israel lobbies, done a lot of nice things for Israel that have nothing to do with the Israeli-Arab conflict, such as massive, massive economic aid, collaboration on Iran issues, technology development, etc. [[User:Benevolent human|Benevolent human]] ([[User talk:Benevolent human|talk]]) 02:58, 15 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ilhan Omar#rfc_D25A0E2|Talk:Ilhan Omar]] expired 2021-06-15 21:01 ===
* Id: D25A0E2
* User: Benevolent human
* Date: 2021-06-12 21:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1028263449|BIO 1028263449}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1028293271|POL 1028293271}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1028293273|RELI 1028293273}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1028759536|BIO 1028759536}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1028759550|POL 1028759550}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1028759553|RELI 1028759553}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We have discussed how information should go in the article to the degree that mainstream reliable sources cover it, per policy. We disputed whether to include Omar's stereotyping of American Jews in the lead on the basis that it was a news story that may have been given short-lived coverage, but we now have continuing coverage of these events over a year later:
* "Omar‚Äôs tweet is the latest among her frequent criticisms of the Israeli government that drew ire from lawmakers of both parties who have condemned them as perpetuating antisemitic stereotypes." - Washington Post [https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/jewish-democrats-omar-israel/2021/06/10/45d5db22-c9e9-11eb-a11b-6c6191ccd599_story.html]
* "Her Twitter comment in 2019 that support in Washington for Israel was ‚Äúall about the Benjamins baby‚Äù kicked off weeks of fighting that ended in a resolution on the House floor condemning bigotry and anti-Semitism. The comments played into anti-Semitic tropes that have roots in the Middle Ages, when Jews were barred from entering most professions and thus became moneylenders ‚Äî a task that Christians would not take on because of prohibitions against usury." [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/10/us/politics/ilhan-omar-israel.html]

Having addressed procedural concerns about the previous RFC, I am therefore opening a new RFC whether, in light of this new information, some mention of criticism of Omar's alleged stereotyping of American Jews unaffiliated with Israel should be mentioned in the lead. [[User:Benevolent human|Benevolent human]] ([[User talk:Benevolent human|talk]]) 21:22, 12 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Riemannian geometry#rfc_76CB7C0|Talk:Riemannian geometry]] expired 2021-06-16 05:01 ===
* Id: 76CB7C0
* User: 198.53.108.48
* Date: 2021-06-14 18:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1028570869|SCI 1028570869}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1028811977|SCI 1028811977}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
the relativity infoboxes on [[Riemannian geometry]] should be moved to [[pseudo-Riemannian geometry]]. 

while Riemannian geometry may have inspired pseudo-Riemannian geometry, which this is one way people can understand its impact on science, the latter is not the former.

i don't think it's appropriate to talk about Riemannian geometry in the terms of physics. 

i would like to move any GR/SR infoboxes on Riemannian concepts to the pseudo-equivalent if they exist. if the equivalent does not exist, i would like to remove it.

enough is enough. we're taking our math back. [[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 18:32, 14 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Leonhard Euler#rfc_8C05AC3|Talk:Leonhard Euler]] expired 2021-06-16 23:01 ===
* Id: 8C05AC3
* User: 198.53.108.48
* Date: 2021-06-16 20:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1028929251|SCI 1028929251}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1028942959|SCI 1028942959}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Euler is described as a physicist in the lead paragraph, but can his predecessors', contemporaries' and own contributions be considered as mathematics when compared to the modern definition of physics?
 
just throwing this out there.

i mean, yes of course he used mathematics to give us some insightful and invaluable explanation for a physical phenomenon.

but i don't think this warrants automatic categorisation under physics since this website has pages explaining and describing the delineation of modern physics from classical physics. 

a good example of modern physics is the [[Lorentz transformation]]. it has been accepted as the cornerstone of physics for a century now.

i note that even when The Greats met the highest burden ([[mathematical proof]]) contributing to our understanding of physical phenomena using mathematics.

physics has not been required to meet this level of proof for some time, at least since the time of maxwell and faraday.

should we remove the description of 'physics' in the lead for The Greats who are known for their contributions to mathematics, since latter entails the former when considering the burden they met? [[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 20:41, 16 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_DE6F897|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2021-06-18 18:01 ===
* Id: DE6F897
* User: ProcrastinatingReader
* Date: 2021-06-18 16:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1029226345|UNSORTED 1029226345}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
====Delete all books within the book namespace'''

<!-- [[User:DoNotArchiveUntil]] 17:01, 23 July 2021 (UTC) -->{{User:ClueBot III/DoNotArchiveUntil|1627059717}}
Editors felt that it should still be possible to access books currently in this namespace. Two options were presented to achieve this: the ability to [[WP:REFUND]] pages on request, and archival by moving pages in the Book namespace to another namespace. There seems to be a rough consensus that the first approach will be satisfactory, although this can be put to further discussion if there is disagreement. If a deletion route is taken then steps should be taken, preceding deletion of the namespace and its pages, to ensure that administrators will be able to provide copies of the deleted page in response to a [[WP:REFUND]] request. [[User:ProcrastinatingReader|ProcrastinatingReader]] ([[User talk:ProcrastinatingReader|talk]]) 16:57, 18 June 2021 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are many [[WP:AUTOCONFIRMED|autoconfirmed]] editors who have no idea that their article is not ready for mainspace. The [[Special:Tags|tag]] <code>#new user moving page out of userspace</code> is quite a good example of this. If you surf through the list of articles at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:RecentChanges?hidebots=1&hidecategorization=1&hideWikibase=1&tagfilter=de-userfying&limit=50&days=7&urlversion=2 you will see many articles that could definitely be [[WP:SPEEDYDELETE|speedy deleted]] and others that just need to be improved more. And of course, there is some legitimate minor page moves like [[Special:Diff/1011516087|this move per WP:ENDASH]]. So here are the options I came up with:

#'''Status quo.''' Automatically mark moves as minor.
#'''Optional.''' Leave the option to mark moves as minor or major.
#'''Required.''' All page moves are marked as major.

Yes, this is not a major issue, but I had to bring it up anyways for the editors that ''do'' hide minor edits. [[User:Sungodtemple|Sungodtemple]] ([[User talk:Sungodtemple|talk]]) 14:40, 22 May 2021 (UTC)}}

* Id: 5FF3802
* User: Kaldari

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1024215049|POLICY 1024215049}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1024250754|SOC 1024250754}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1029408457|POLICY 1029408457}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In 2020, I [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=986810816 changed the sentence]...
:Flag icons may be relevant in some subject areas, where the subject {{!xt|'''actually'''}} represents that country or nationality.
... to ...
:Flag icons may be relevant in some subject areas, where the subject {{xt|'''officially'''}} represents that country or nationality.
This was to address [[Talk:Now_United#No,_flags_are_not_limited_to_sports|misinterpretation of the sentence]] as meaning that flag icons were acceptable to indicate that a person was merely from a particular country, and thus "represented" it. This change was recently reverted. I am now asking for opinions on whether this change should be reinstated. [[User:Kaldari|Kaldari]] ([[User talk:Kaldari|talk]]) 19:53, 20 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Number theory#rfc_6224B57|Talk:Number theory]] expired 2021-06-24 17:01 ===
* Id: 6224B57
* User: 198.53.108.48
* Date: 2021-06-23 23:10:00

{{rfcquote|text=
is it fair to include a portrait of sir andrew wiles on the Number Theory page, considering there is a picture of erdos and terry?

i mean, he did prove The Last Theorem, right?

it seems there is a bit of text dedicated to this theorem on the page, right?
: from what i can see, it's mentioned under Early modern number theory, subsections fermat, euler, and 'lagrange, legendre and gauss'.

i know some would say he's not any of the people on this page, the 'lowest' probably being Erdos or terry. i respect all these guys.

but my view is if Erdos gets a spot, so does sir andrew. he did prove it. and he deserves some recognition outside of the fermat's last theorem page.

just my 2c

before i forget, just for redrose74: "[[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 23:10, 23 June 2021 (UTC)}}

* Date: 2021-05-25 19:54:00

Currently the article contains the positions of the WHO, CDC, European Medical Agency (EMA) whose consensus is that ivermectin should not be used for treating covid until clinical trials are done. #Should the positions of national public health agencies on ivermectin be mentioned in this article?

=== [[Talk:Gaudeamus igitur#rfc_66563A3|Talk:Gaudeamus igitur]] expired 2021-06-25 05:01 ===
* Id: 66563A3
* User: Rowsdower45
* Date: 2021-05-26 04:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1025176785|MEDIA 1025176785}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1030313013|MEDIA 1030313013}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the Latin transcription of the lyrics include the line "Post iucundam iuventutem?" A great variety of sources include this line, as do most English-language translations of the song/poem, but one editor is insistent upon loyalty to a particular source that omits this line. Please observe the various sources that I have provided, and will repeat here in footnote form.<ref>''Studentenlieder. ‚Äì Aus den hinterlassenen Papieren eines ungl√ºcklichen Philosophen Florido genannt, gesammlet und verbessert von C. W. K. [i.e. Christian Wilhelm Kindleben]'' 1781, S. 52‚Äì54 (Titelseite mit einem Blatt) bzw. 56‚Äì58 (Titelseite mit Blume und Beiwerk).</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.users.on.net/~algernon/gaudeamus/translation.html |title=Gaudeamus Igitur - English Translation |publisher=Karl's Choral Music Webpage |access-date=2021-05-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://morec.com/rpc/gaudeamus.htm |title=Gaudeamus igitur |publisher=Dr. Christopher S. Morrissey, [[Trinity Western University]] |access-date=2021-05-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://lyricstranslate.com/en/de-brevitate-vitae-gaudeamus-igitur-about-shortness-life-so-lets-be-merry.html |title=De Brevitate Vitae (Gaudeamus Igitur) (English translation) |publisher=LyricsTranslate.com |access-date=2021-05-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/3287680?seq=13#metadata_info_tab_contents |title=Three latin Students' Songs |publisher=[[JSTOR]] |access-date=2021-05-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://culture.fandom.com/wiki/Gaudeamus_igitur |title=The Culture Wiki:Gaudeamus Igitur |publisher=The Culture Wiki |access-date=2021-05-04}}</ref> [[User:Rowsdower45|Rowsdower45]] ([[User talk:Rowsdower45|talk]]) 04:49, 26 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Archimedes#rfc_21B18CA|Talk:Archimedes]] expired 2021-06-26 13:01 ===
* Id: 21B18CA
* User: 198.53.108.48
* Date: 2021-06-21 19:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1029749838|SCI 1029749838}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1030224294|SCI 1030224294}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
i disagree that euclid deserves to be in the infobox as an influence for archimedes.

i am not disputing archimedes read his work, best evidenced by his "author of the Elements" quote.

however, i just don't see it. i consider euclid and archimedes to be exact opposites. 

for a long time the influences and influenced portions of his infobox were blank, and recently there have been some introductions.

i call upon the community to argue and discuss the appropriateness of these insertions, given the scarcity of verified information we have on this figure.

if anyone influenced archimedes, i would argue it's [[Thales]] or [[Pythagoras]]. obviously no evidence for that either, nor am i asking for comment on that.
: this is merely an off-the-cuff comment when i assess archimedes' work in the context of the two individuals i've named above. it fits better. but again i am not asking for comment or approval on that.

should we keep the influences and influenced fields for archimedes infobox? [[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 19:48, 21 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Archimedes#rfc_D60116F|Talk:Archimedes]] expired 2021-06-26 16:01 ===
* Id: D60116F
* User: 198.53.108.48
* Date: 2021-06-26 12:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1030541900|SCI 1030541900}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
archimedes is a significant figure in the history of many fields, including mathematics, physics and general science. are the influence{s,d} infobox attributes appropriate for a figure of his stature?

sorry for the new rfc, but this has been bugging me. i would ask readers to consider the fact i spent at least 5 hours investigating and contributing to these additions, and i ended up concluding they're not necessary.

i would like to have a discussion with the larger audience about whether we need the influence{s,d} infobox attributes for archimedes, given how many people he influenced and how his work shaped multiple fields.
: indeed, the lead of the article suggests he could be seen as the forefather of a entire field(s), which suggests the worthy additions to the infobox could far exceed a handful when including popular and important contributors from the 'teen' centuries.

i think it would be better to leave the infobox as it was before, which did not have the influence{s,d} fields. it is known how important he was, and i think making any list of figures just dilutes or potentially erodes from that.

thoughts?
"[[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 12:22, 26 June 2021 (UTC)}}

In {{tl|Infobox film}}, should "Produced by" and "Music by" be moved so the fields appear in the following order?

* Directed by
* Written by
* Screenplay by
* Story by
* Based on
* Produced by
* Starring
* Narrated by
* Cinematography
* Edited by
* Music by
* (Production companies and remaining parameters stay the same)

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (people)#rfc_18C879A|Wikipedia talk:Notability (people)]] expired 2021-06-28 16:01 ===
* Id: 18C879A
* User: Nsk92
* Date: 2021-05-29 15:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1025791384|POLICY 1025791384}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1030892052|POLICY 1030892052}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the portion of [[WP:BASIC]] currently reading {{font color|green|If the depth of coverage in any given source is not substantial, then multiple independent sources may be combined to demonstrate notability}} be:

*'''Option A.''' Retained as is.
*'''Option B.''' Deleted altogether.
*'''Option C.''' Modified to: {{font color|green|If no multiple independent sources providing substantial coverage are available, then multiple independent sources may be combined to demonstrate notability. At least one independent source providing substantial in-depth coverage of the subject is still required in this case.}}
*'''Option D.''' Modified to: {{font color|green|If the depth of coverage in any given source is not substantial, then multiple independent sources may be combined to demonstrate notability. In this case the overall amount of information about the subject provided by independent reliable sources should be at least as great as when substantial in-depth coverage by multiple such sources were available.}}
*'''Option E.''' Modified to: {{font color|green|If no multiple independent sources providing substantial coverage are available, then multiple independent sources may be combined to demonstrate notability. The overall amount of information about the subject provided by independent reliable sources should be at least as great as when substantial in-depth coverage by multiple such sources were available. At least one independent source providing substantial in-depth coverage of the subject is still required in this case.}}
[[User:Nsk92|Nsk92]] ([[User talk:Nsk92|talk]]) 15:41, 29 May 2021 (UTC)}}

How should the first sentence of this article refer to its subject? This inevitably affects the rest of the article, but this is the crux of the issue. Four basic options:

=== [[Talk:Holodomor in modern politics#rfc_B39DA75|Talk:Holodomor in modern politics]] expired 2021-06-29 09:01 ===
* Id: B39DA75
* User: Stix1776
* Date: 2021-05-30 08:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1025911840|POL 1025911840}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031015301|POL 1031015301}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There's been a difficultly amongst editors regarding the statement "Sixty-nine states have signed declarations in statements at the UNGA affirming that the Holodomor was as a 'national tragedy of the Ukrainian people'..." The issue is whether it is OK to count the number of countries from the UN General Assembly statements from 4 documents [https://undocs.org/A/C.3/58/9], [https://undocs.org/A/C.3/58/9/Add.1], [https://undocs.org/A/63/613], [https://undocs.org/A/68/655], and [https://undocs.org/A/73/630]. No primary or secondary sources lists the count, however per [[WP:CALC]] routine calculations are allowed.

To be honest, I was the skeptical editor and didn't trust the 69 number for the longest time. It's an utter pain trying to calculate all the unique countries, so I wrote a Python script to do it[https://pastebin.com/cQ4vVzTu]. I'm still not 100% sure if I'm correct. I've never seen a page try to do this, so I'm worried that it's OR.

There are a few options:
*'''A: Keep the text as 69 (or 70), explicitly listing the amount'''
*'''B: Write "at least 69 (or 70)"'''
*'''C: Change it to "many countries" or something similar''' [[User:Stix1776|Stix1776]] ([[User talk:Stix1776|talk]]) 08:09, 30 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Azov Battalion#rfc_60728D3|Talk:Azov Battalion]] expired 2021-06-29 19:01 ===
* Id: 60728D3
* User: Szmenderowiecki
* Date: 2021-05-30 18:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1025988779|HIST 1025988779}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1025988792|POL 1025988792}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1031087454|HIST 1031087454}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031087469|POL 1031087469}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The previous [[Talk:Azov Battalion/Archive 1#Far-right%2C%20neo-Nazi%20as%20result%20of%20WP:NPOV%20rule%20ignoration|RfC]] has come to the conclusion the Azov Battalion can't be described as neo-Nazi, but several editors have noted that a new RfC is needed to settle the matter.

1. '''In the first sentence''' (Azov Battalion is a ___________ Ukrainian National Guard regiment), '''which adjective, if any, should be used to describe the political ideology of the military unit?'''

:a. Right-wing/nationalist;
:b. Far-right;
:c. Neo-Nazi;
:d. Do not use any adjective.
:e. neo-fascist

2. '''How should the article handle reports on Azov's links to neo-Nazi groups and descriptions as being such?''' (Note. You may combine answers from A-C with D-E).
:a. Mention that many political observers and news outlets have described it as a neo-Nazi organization;
:b. Mention that many political observers and news outlets have reported extensively on its links to neo-Nazi groups;
:c. Mention that many political observers and news outlets have described it as neo-Nazi and reported extensively on having links to neo-Nazi groups;
:d. State in wikivoice it is linked to neo-Nazis;
:e. State in wikivoice it is neo-Nazi;
:f. Do not include the information in the lead. 
:g. Mention that many political observers and news outlets have described it as a neo-fascist organization. (Using "Nazi" has baggage, since there may be weaker ties to WWII-era Hitlerism than to other modern neo-fascist groups, who may be as inspired by, say, Mussolini as by Hitler).
:[[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]] ([[User talk:Szmenderowiecki|talk]]) 18:32, 30 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Investigations into the origin of COVID-19#rfc_F90ABFA|Talk:Investigations into the origin of COVID-19]] expired 2021-06-30 01:01 ===
* Id: F90ABFA
* Date: 2021-06-25 18:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1030410506|SCI 1030410506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1030410516|POL 1030410516}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1031137028|SCI 1031137028}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031137039|POL 1031137039}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Throughout this article, we often refer to a report published by the WHO about the origins of SARS-COV-2 [https://www.who.int/publications/i/item/who-convened-global-study-of-origins-of-sars-cov-2-china-part].

The basic question of this RfC is: '''How should we refer to this report?'''

This is a more complicated question than it might seem at first glance, and I encourage all editors to read the evidence presented below these options before weighing in.

{{underline|Here are the options as I see them}}:

* '''A''': Refer to it as the "'''{{tq|Joint WHO-China study}}'''" in the lead and then explain the process of how the study/report came to be, who was involved in what capacity, etc.
* '''B''': Refer to it as the "'''{{tq|WHO-convened study}}'''" in the lead and then explain the process of how the study/report came to be, who was involved in what capacity, etc.
* '''C''': A mix between '''A''' and '''B''' where we refer to the study/report throughout the article switching off between the two names, with the first usage being "'''{{tq|Joint WHO-China study}}'''."
* '''D''': Variant of '''C''' where we switch off, but the first usage is "'''{{tq|WHO-convened study}}'''."
* '''E''': We scrap this dispute altogether and use '''novel language''' such as "'''{{tq|WHO-convened study conducted jointly with China}}'''" or "'''{{tq|joint study convened by the WHO and conducted with China}}'''."

RfC prepared 18:31, 25 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Red Party (Norway)#rfc_9D1B39B|Talk:Red Party (Norway)]] expired 2021-06-30 11:01 ===
* Id: 9D1B39B
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2021-05-31 10:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1026100423|POL 1026100423}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031212634|POL 1031212634}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think we should remove the ideologies of democratic socialism, eco-socialism, feminism and republicanism from the infobox as these are only supported by the party's website, which is not an [[WP:INDEPENDENT|independent source]]. However, [[U|Vif12vf]] said - ''"Because you largely can't find good third-party sources describing actual ideologies in Norway because ideology is not a subject ever spoken of in specifics, and practically all norwegian media outlets have a specific political standpoint meaning they lack neutrality on the subject."'' Personally, I do not have the knowledge to support or deny this claim. However, either way I don't think we should let claims stand that can't be backed by at least one reliable independent source. Also, even with these ideologies removed there will still be multiple ideologies left listed in the infobox (revolutionary socialism, communism, Marxism and hard Euroscepticism), all of which are supported by at least one independent source. I think this is enough ideologies to go with for the infobox. The infobox is too overloaded with 8 different ideologies, 4 is enough and these are properly cited. The infobox is supposed to be a summary and I've seen multiple editors state we should be limiting the number of ideologies we include the infobox to just a couple. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 10:59, 31 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_4F104DD|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2021-07-01 00:01 ===
* Id: 4F104DD
* User: Elli
* Date: 2021-06-02 04:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1026418933|POLICY 1026418933}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1031369051|POLICY 1031369051}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Speedy deletion criterion U3 currently reads as follows:
{{quote|[[Wikipedia:Picture tutorial#Galleries|Galleries]] in the userspace that consist mostly or entirely of [[Wikipedia:Non-free content|"fair use" or non-free images]]. Wikipedia's non-free content policy prohibits the use of non-free content in userspace, even content that the user has uploaded; use of content in the public domain or under a free license is acceptable.}}
This criterion is unnecessary for multiple reasons. First, non-free media is automatically removed from non-articles by {{u|JJMC89 bot}}, usually within a few hours of being added. There is no way to disable this, meaning that it's not possible for a non-free gallery to stick around in userspace for long.
Secondly, these pages would be, if necessary, eligible for criterion under U5: a non-free media gallery is not closely aligned with Wikipedia's goals of being a free encyclopedia.

Following this, the criterion is rarely if ever used. I created a list of [[User:Elli/Last deletions|the 2500 most recent page deletions]] - not a single U3 among them. There is no reason to keep a redundant criterion that doesn't solve any problem that currently exists. [[User:Elli|Elli]] ([[User_talk:Elli|talk]] &#124; [[Special:Contributions/Elli|contribs]]) 04:13, 2 June 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_F43E1C7|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2021-07-01 00:01 ===
* Id: F43E1C7
* User: TenPoundHammer
* Date: 2021-05-31 23:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1026205545|POLICY 1026205545}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1031315538|POLICY 1031315538}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The other day I tagged {{tl|Qonja}} for a G8 speedy, as I considered it a "subpage with no parent page" (the header article [[Qonja]] does not exist). {{user|Fastily}} overturned the G8 and upon being asked, responded that they didn't feel it fit G8.

I see no benefit to keeping a page around and letting it spend God knows how long in XFD simply because there isn't a CSD that clearly fits it. This seems like a blatantly obvious template to delete speedily, even if it doesn't quite fit squarely into an existing G8 or other CSD category. If the parent article -- that is, the article the navigational template is named after and/or clearly intended to be used on -- has been deleted or does not exist, that seems like it falls under "subpages dependent on a nonexistant or deleted page", and I don't understand why it's not already cited as an example of something fitting G8.

tl;dr: '''''Should G8 be amended to include "navigational templates where the parent article has been deleted or does not exist"?''''' I say yes for the reasons I just stated.

<span style="color:green">'''Ten Pound Hammer'''</span> ‚Ä¢ <sup>([[User talk:TenPoundHammer|What did I screw up now?]])</sup> 23:46, 31 May 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:In the news#rfc_4947601|Wikipedia talk:In the news]] expired 2021-07-01 14:01 ===
* Id: 4947601
* Date: 2021-06-01 13:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1026302543|POL 1026302543}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031417734|POL 1031417734}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
At [[Wikipedia:In the news/Candidates#(Posted) Syrian presidential election]], there is much controversy about whether the ITN blurb about the [[2021 Syrian presidential election]] should reflect, as the article does, that the election was not free or fair according to reliable sources. Currently the blurb reads only "[[Bashar al-Assad]] is '''[[2021 Syrian presidential election|re-elected]]''' as [[president of Syria]]."

I propose that we seek to find consensus for future similar cases by selecting one of two possible options (with suboptions):

*'''Option 1: No qualification.''' E.g.: "X is elected president of Fooland".
*'''Option 2: With a qualification''' (a) in Wikipedia's voice or (b) attributed to sources, or (c) either, depending on the stable wording in the article's lead. E.g.: "X is elected president of Fooland in unfree elections", or "X is elected president of Fooland in, according to international media, unfree elections.".

<small><span style="border:1px solid black;padding:1px;">[[User:Sandstein|<span style="color:white;background:blue;font-family:sans-serif;">''' Sandstein '''</span>]]</span></small> 13:58, 1 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:WCW World Television Championship#rfc_9DC912E|Template talk:WCW World Television Championship]] expired 2021-07-03 14:05 ===
* Id: 9DC912E
* User: McPhail
* Date: 2021-06-03 13:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1026652360|TECH 1026652360}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1031763326|TECH 1031763326}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I would welcome a view on the colour schemes used in various professional wrestling navigational templates. I've added the RfC here but there are many more examples, e.g. as seen [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:World_Championship_Wrestling_navigational_boxes here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:WWE_championship_navigational_boxes here].

There's an increasing tendency for editors to add idiosyncratic colour schemes, some of them very vividly coloured, to these templates. I have concerned that this may be causing some issues with reference to the below points:

*[[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Professional_wrestling/Archive_109#template_colors|"Ensure that color is not the only method used to convey important information. Especially, do not use colored text or background unless its status is also indicated using another method, such as an accessible symbol matched to a legend, or footnote labels. Otherwise, blind users or readers accessing Wikipedia through a printout or device without a color screen will not receive that information.]]"
*[[Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Professional_wrestling/Archive_109#template_colors|"Some readers of Wikipedia are partially or fully color-blind or visually impaired. Ensure the contrast of the text with its background reaches at least Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.0's AA level, and AAA level when feasible (see WCAG's "Understanding SC 1.4.3: Contrast (Minimum)").]]" 

I would welcome views from the community on whether or not these colour schemes are potentially creating issues.  [[User:McPhail|McPhail]] ([[User talk:McPhail|talk]]) 13:29, 3 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Blackbird (land yacht)#rfc_A9A23AF|Talk:Blackbird (land yacht)]] expired 2021-07-04 23:01 ===
* Id: A9A23AF
* User: HopsonRoad
* Date: 2021-07-04 16:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1031945436|SCI 1031945436}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1031945444|SOC 1031945444}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1031993637|SCI 1031993637}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1031993639|SOC 1031993639}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I note that [[Land yacht]] redirects to [[Land sailing]], where all the vehicle shown are sail-powered, and that [[Wind-powered vehicle]] includes rotor-driven vehicles, like ''Blackbird''. Furthermore, Merriam-Webster defines "land yacht" as a "3-wheel wind-driven recreation vehicle consisting usually of a bare-frame structure and a single sail and used especially on areas of firmly packed sand" or "a large motor vehicle", which shows ambiguity of meaning. Furthermore a [[Yacht]] often connotes on-board accommodations. Therefore, by the [[WP:SURPRISE|principle of least astonishment]], I recommend moving this article to [[Blackbird (wind-powered vehicle)]]. Cheers, [[User:HopsonRoad|HopsonRoad]] ([[User talk:HopsonRoad|talk]]) 16:00, 4 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television#rfc_267FB55|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television]] expired 2021-07-10 18:01 ===
* Id: 267FB55
* User: Bluerules
* Date: 2021-06-21 06:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1029648497|MEDIA 1029648497}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1034675647|MEDIA 1034675647}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:John F. Kennedy#rfc_1F3A17E|Talk:John F. Kennedy]] expired 2021-07-10 22:01 ===
* Id: 1F3A17E
* User: SamStrongTalks
* Date: 2021-06-10 21:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1027939492|BIO 1027939492}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1032987000|BIO 1032987000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1032987002|HIST 1032987002}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1032987012|POL 1032987012}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the year they were assassinated be included in the prose in the first sentence?

This could be construed as redundant since the date of death is included in the first text of the article {{tq|'''John Fitzgerald Kennedy''' (May 29, 1917 ‚Äì November 22, 1963)}} 

For context, [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]], [[Warren G. Harding]], [[William Mckinley]], [[James A. Garfield]], [[Abraham Lincoln]], [[Zachary Taylor]], and [[William Henry Harrison]] include the year of their death in the first sentence of prose for the article in addition to the birth and death dates.

There doesn't appear to be clear guidance on [[WP:MOS]]. Let me know if there is a better way to state each position. &#123;&#123;u&#124;[[User:SamStrongTalks|SamStrongTalks]]&#125;&#125;&nbsp;<sup>([[User talk:SamStrongTalks|Talk]])</sup> 21:55, 10 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_3F60DA0|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2021-07-11 00:01 ===
* Id: 3F60DA0
* User: Trillfendi

* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1032998956|BIO 1032998956}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
If a person has expressed they are not a citizen of a country, and that is sourced, should they still be called a citizen in the lead even when they are only a permanent resident? Essentially, should permanent resident be removed from this criteria so as to not confuse anyone? It currently says, {{xt|The opening paragraph should usually provide context for the activities that made the person notable. In most modern-day cases, this will be the country, region, or territory, where the person is a citizen, national, or permanent resident; or, if the person is notable mainly for past events, where the person was a citizen, national, or permanent resident when the person became notable.}}  [[User:Trillfendi|Trillfendi]] ([[User talk:Trillfendi|talk]]) 00:00, 11 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Largest cities#rfc_D431A57|Template talk:Largest cities]] expired 2021-07-12 04:01 ===
* Id: D431A57
* User: Catchpoke
* Date: 2021-06-12 03:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1028194882|TECH 1028194882}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1033183120|TECH 1033183120}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3AWhatLinksHere&target=Template%3ALargest+cities&namespace=0 In article space], this template is used in numerous city articles but in a recent [[Wikipedia:Templates for discussion/Log/2021 May 17#Template:Largest cities of Israel|template discussion]], it was determined that there is no policy which states national level templates should be kept.

The policy relevant here is [[WP:NAVCOLOR]] and that would mean that this template and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special%3AWhatLinksHere&target=Template%3ALargest+cities&namespace=10 templates that implement it] would need to be deprecated and deleted.

[[WP:NAVCOLOR]] is applicable here because the design is arbitrary and capricious.  This is due to the fact that this template gives options to list either 10 or 20 city entries and either 0, 1, 2, 3, or 4 pictures of cities and these options prevent the internal dimensions of the template from staying consistent. [[User:Catchpoke|Catchpoke]] ([[User talk:Catchpoke|talk]]) 03:20, 12 June 2021 (UTC)}}

just in the off-chance {{ping|SilverMatsu}} and {{ping|Researcherphd}} engage in a dispute over the quote, i want to say that i like it.

and while applied mathematics isn't explicitly mentioned by engels, he does specifically state 'pure mathematics'. the question i guess would be: was there any distinction at that time?

since engels was born in 1820 it would be fair to say we had a few titans who were active in this time period, Lords [[John William Strutt, 3rd Baron Rayleigh|rayleigh]] and [[William Thomson, 1st Baron Kelvin|kelvin]] immediately coming to mind.

what do others think? i will admit i'm not a huge hardy fan, but that in no way affects my opinion on the relevance of the engels quote.

what do you think dr {{ping|David Eppstein}} ?

maybe some context around the quote would help, but it seems to stand well on its own. [[Special:Contributions/198.53.108.48|198.53.108.48]] ([[User talk:198.53.108.48|talk]]) 20:13, 12 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:James Barry (surgeon)#rfc_13CDB6A|Talk:James Barry (surgeon)]] expired 2021-07-14 19:01 ===
* Id: 13CDB6A
* User: Tamzin
* Date: 2021-06-14 18:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1028570864|BIO 1028570864}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1033610008|BIO 1033610008}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{bcc|Peaceray|NekoKatsun|GreenComputer|Autumnking2012}}For years there has been dispute as to which pronouns this biography should use to refer to its subject. In 2017 {{u|Wilderwill}} edited the article to only refer to Barry by his surname (see {{slink||A_New_Solution_to_the_Pronouns_Issue}}), a compromise that saw no opposition (although also not much support). In the years since, that compromise has become the ''status quo''.

Notably, over the years, there has been no discussion of the applicability of [[MOS:GENDERID]], the guideline that governs biographical subjects' pronouns, which advises (emphases added):{{tqb|Refer to '''any person whose gender might be questioned''' with gendered words (e.g. pronouns, "man/woman", "waiter/waitress") that reflect the person's '''latest expressed gender self-identification''' as reported in the most recent reliable sources, even if it does not match what is most common in sources. This holds for any phase of the person's life, unless they have indicated a preference otherwise.}}

Much discussion in the past has focused on whether Barry was [[transgender]], but GENDERID is not exclusive to transgender people. '''It is not the goal of this RfC to determine whether Barry was transgender, or what his "true" gender identity was''' (or for that matter what his sex was). This RfC instead asks two questions:
# For the purposes of GENDERID, is it accurate to say that Barry's "latest expressed gender self-identification" was as a man?
# Should we follow GENDERID in this case?
("Yes" to both would mean switching to he/him pronouns. For any other answer, please state your preferred outcome.)<span class="nowrap"><span style="font-family:courier;font-size:90%"> -- [[User:Tamzin|Tamzin]]</span> (she/they)</span> &#124; <span class="nowrap">[[User talk:Tamzin|o toki tawa mi.]]</span> 18:31, 14 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Britain's Got Talent#rfc_F604797|Template talk:Britain's Got Talent]] expired 2021-07-15 09:01 ===
* Id: F604797
* User: GUtt01
* Date: 2021-07-08 14:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1032614565|TECH 1032614565}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1033701209|TECH 1033701209}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is for not only this template, but all templates covering a international television edition of the ''Got Talent'' franchise. Under the section in this template denoted as "Other Notable Contestant", how should this field be defined by editors? Please answer with the following; more than one choice may be given, but please explain your reasoning:

*'''A''' The contestant made a notable career for themselves before appearing on a ''Got Talent'' programme.
*'''B''' The contestant became notable for their performance during their appearance on a ''Got Talent'' programme.
*'''C''' The contestant became notable for beginning a career after appearing on a ''Got Talent'' programme.

The need to define this section is due to the amount of Wikilinks being used in templates crafted with this section, such as [[Template:Britain's Got Talent]] and [[Template:America's Got Talent]]. Its need clear clarification to editors how this should be defined as in terms of relevant articles/subject matter. [[User:GUtt01|GUtt01]] ([[User talk:GUtt01|talk]]) 14:23, 8 July 2021 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

=== [[Talk:List of nicknames used by Donald Trump#rfc_044C2CA|Talk:List of nicknames used by Donald Trump]] expired 2021-07-16 07:01 ===
* Id: 044C2CA
* User: Chess
* Date: 2021-06-30 07:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1031192928|MEDIA 1031192928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1031192930|POL 1031192930}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1031199176|BIO 1031199176}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1033848156|BIO 1033848156}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1033848167|MEDIA 1033848167}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1033848176|POL 1033848176}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Do you support or oppose the following inclusion criteria for this list?

All nicknames added to this list should meet the following criteria
*Described as a nickname by at least one secondary, independent, reliable source.
*Described as being used by Trump by at least one secondary, independent, reliable source.
*Trump should have used the nickname on at least two separate occasions.
*There should be lasting coverage of the nickname.
[[User:Chess|Chess]] ([[User talk:Chess|talk]]) <small>(please use&#32;{{tlx|reply to|Chess}} on reply)</small>{{Z181}} 07:53, 30 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Education noticeboard#rfc_A506CF7|Wikipedia:Education noticeboard]] expired 2021-07-18 23:01 ===
* Id: A506CF7
* User: Chess
* Date: 2021-06-18 22:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1029269958|PROP 1029269958}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1034276438|PROP 1034276438}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The above section on "minimum word counts in assignments" [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Education_noticeboard&oldid=1029153209#Minimum_word_counts_in_assignments] has brought to my attention that we don't have any formal consensus on whether instructors should be allowed to grade students based on the amount of words or edits they have added to the English Wikipedia. Anyways I'm starting this RfC to resolve the matter (for clarification, "student assignments" means '''all''' editing activity to the English Wikipedia performed as part of a educational course, regardless of whether or not the course is under [[WP:Wiki Ed]]) [[User:Chess|Chess]] ([[User talk:Chess|talk]]) <small>(please use&#32;{{tlx|reply to|Chess}} on reply)</small>{{Z181}} 22:55, 18 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Film and game ratings#rfc_57A1476|Template talk:Film and game ratings]] expired 2021-07-25 05:01 ===
* Id: 57A1476
* User: Gerald Waldo Luis
* Date: 2021-06-25 04:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1030313020|STYLE 1030313020}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1030313024|PROJ 1030313024}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1035352302|STYLE 1035352302}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1035352307|PROJ 1035352307}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In 2020, IP 109.79.176.62 [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Film_and_game_ratings&oldid=988152847 brought up] the concern that the Film and game ratings template is rarely used in articles, and suggested deletion. Later in 2021, 109.78.194.208 began removing it in several articles. At WikiProject Film, they [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia_talk:WikiProject_Film&oldid=1029951595 brought up] the concern that the template might be abused. The WPFILM thread sees no resolution, and the template continues to be removed, such as [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Hellraiser:_Judgment&diff=1030039913&oldid=1027916296&diffmode=source in ''Hellraiser: Judgment's article] by 109.76.200.100.

So, what should happen to Film and game ratings:

A. Keep, and recommend it at [[MOS:FILM]] to widen usage, like in [[MOS:VG]]

B. Keep, and retain its optional fashion

C. Delete it

Thanks--- '''[[User:Gerald Waldo Luis|<span style="background:#4C516D; color:white; padding:2px;">Gerald</span>]][[User talk:Gerald Waldo Luis|<span style="background:#B9CFF0; color:black; padding:2px;">WL</span>]]''' 04:51, 25 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fidesz#rfc_795B2D6|Talk:Fidesz]] expired 2021-07-25 15:01 ===
* Id: 795B2D6
* User: Vacant0
* Date: 2021-06-25 14:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1030375231|POL 1030375231}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1035416459|POL 1035416459}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm opening this RfC due to recent disruptive editing and because a known Hungarian user KIENGIR who participated in previous discussions has been banned earlier this year.

1) Infobox cleanup ‚Äì keeping "National conservatism", "Social conservatism", "Right-wing populism", "Economic nationalism", "Euroscepticism" and "Anti-immigration" in the infobox including the present political position. Illiberalism itself isn't an ideology and the historical section can be instead moved to the introduction, in my opinion, they don't have to stay in the infobox. The source for Christian democracy is old and that label itself isn't used today to describe the party, but, if there are recent sources describing the party like that, then it can stay.

2) Right-wing ‚Üí far-right ‚Äì Should the infobox and introduction state the party as solely "far-right", or should the status quo remain?

3) Introduction ‚Äì Regarding the introduction, it can be expanded to include their current and historical political positions and ideologies. The general question for this one is "Should illiberalism and authoritarianism get included in the introduction?" (eg. [[Law and Justice]]'s page).

While voting, use '''support''' and '''oppose''' in the subsections below. Discussing how the introduction should look can be discussed in the "Discussion" subsection below. --[[User:Vacant0|Vacant0]] ([[User talk:Vacant0|talk]]) 14:42, 25 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject United States Presidents#rfc_123B159|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject United States Presidents]] expired 2021-07-26 11:01 ===
* Id: 123B159
* User: Spy-cicle#top
* Date: 2021-07-14 22:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1033646329|BIO 1033646329}}

[[User:Spy-cicle|<span style='color: 4019FF;'><b>&nbsp;Spy-cicleüí•&nbsp;</b></span>]] [[User talk:Spy-cicle#top|<sup><span style='color: #1e1e1e;'><b>'''''Talk'''''?</b></span></sup>]] 22:02, 14 July 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Citing sources#rfc_BD022E1|Wikipedia talk:Citing sources]] expired 2021-07-26 13:01 ===
* Id: BD022E1
* User: Mjroots
* Date: 2021-06-26 12:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1030521322|POLICY 1030521322}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1035573243|POLICY 1035573243}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Recently, I've come across an editor who is removing reference names from articles ''where the reference is only used once'' in the article. Thus <code><ref name=ABC123></code> becomes <code><ref></code>. This is not the same as consolidating references where a full reference is later repeated in full and is cut back to use the shortened ref name. The removal of named references is something I'm not comfortable with. Even if a reference is only used once, it is handy to have it named. Another editor may come along later and insert material so that the reference now needs to be used more than once. If it is named, the is is a simple matter of re-using the existing name. Without a name, the editor then needs to give the reference a name, and maybe also check for other uses of that reference elsewhere in the article. I appreciate that any "harm" done by these actions is minimal, and I'm not looking to get editors who have done this in the past sanctioned. What I would like to happen is that the issue is fully discussed and a consensus formed as to whether or not the practice of removing reference names should be deprecated. My preference is that if an editor has named a reference, then it should stay named. Others may feel different, but lets discuss this please. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 12:22, 26 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_59C5AD9|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2021-07-26 13:01 ===
* Id: 59C5AD9
* User: Awesome Aasim
* Date: 2021-07-18 22:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1034276438|PROP 1034276438}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1039304915|PROP 1039304915}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What should we do to all foreign-language interface messages (like [[MediaWiki:Abusefilter-disallowed/de]])? Should we:
* '''Keep all''' of the foreign-language messages, or
* '''Delete all''' of the foreign-language messages, or
* '''Keep some''', but '''delete others'''
This is following up from an [[Wikipedia:Miscellany for deletion/MediaWiki:Abusefilter-disallowed/de|MFD]] where there was consensus to keep the messages but get wider input in the village pump. I have been procrastinating this due to university, but I think it is finally time to debate it.
[[User:Awesome Aasim|Aasim]] ([[User talk:Awesome Aasim|talk]]) 22:53, 18 July 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_B8A63BD|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2021-07-26 13:01 ===
* Id: B8A63BD
* User: Primefac#Follow-up RfC to TFA PC protection trial]]; courtesy pings, and thanks for the heads-up, to {{u
* Date: 2021-06-26 12:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1030521327|PROP 1030521327}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1035573245|PROP 1035573245}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A one-month trial was authorised in April 2021 following [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)/Archive 178#Pending-changes protection of Today's featured article]]. I understand that that trial has now ended (see [[User talk:Primefac#Follow-up RfC to TFA PC protection trial]]; courtesy pings, and thanks for the heads-up, to {{u|Goszei}} and {{u|Primefac}}). I am therefore opening this discussion to invite comments as to how it went, and what (if anything) to do next.

Consider me neutral. All I will say is, that I don't think I've seen a request for protection of a TFA at [[WP:ANI]] since February 2021.

Pinging all editors who took part in the original discussion: {{u|TheDragonFire300}}, {{u|Iridescent}}, {{u|Redrose64}}, {{u|J√©sk√© Couriano}}, {{u|Izno}}, {{u|Thryduulf}}, {{u|Vaticidalprophet}}, {{u|Wugapodes}}, {{u|Buidhe}}, {{u|Nosebagbear}}, {{u|Mz7}}, {{u|Bilorv}}, {{u|Hawkeye7}}, {{u|Aza24}}, {{u|HAL333}}, {{u|RandomCanadian}}, {{u|Elli}}, {{u|Extraordinary Writ}}, {{u|firefly}}, {{u|Pinchme123}}, {{u|Yair rand}}, {{u|Espresso Addict}}, {{u|Levivich}}, {{u|Zoozaz1}}, {{u|Venicescapes}}, {{u|ToBeFree}}, {{u|Waddie96}}, {{u|ONUnicorn}}, {{u|Kusma}}, {{u|Dennis Brown}}, {{u|CaptainEek}}, {{u|Jason Quinn}}, {{u|Nsk92}}, {{u|Snow Rise}}, {{u|MusikAnimal}}, {{u|King of Hearts}}, {{u|Wretchskull}}, {{u|ProcrastinatingReader}}, {{u|Phil Bridger}}, {{u|Asartea}} and {{u|Âäõ}} (and {{u|Somebody "Notme" Else}}, who unaccountably did not). [[User:Narky Blert|Narky Blert]] ([[User talk:Narky Blert|talk]]) 12:06, 26 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Jimmy Savile#rfc_41CEADA|Talk:Jimmy Savile]] expired 2021-07-27 16:01 ===
* Id: 41CEADA
* User: Oiyarbepsy
* Date: 2021-07-04 02:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1031859996|BIO 1031859996}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1035775576|BIO 1035775576}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Every couple of months, an editor adds child molester, sex offender, or similar, to either the first sentence of the article or the short description. All of these edits have been promptly reverted, and a group of regular editors argue against this. The argument against including this is that Savile was never tried in a court of law or convicted of such acts. The counter-argument is that his crimes weren't known until after his death (making a trial impossible) and all reliable sources describe as a child molester and that there is no serious doubt that he molested hundreds of children.

So the question for this RFC is: '''Should the first sentence of the article and the short description describe Savile as a child molester?''' [[User:Oiyarbepsy|Oiyarbepsy]] ([[User talk:Oiyarbepsy|talk]]) 02:10, 4 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Identifying reliable sources (medicine)#rfc_1E16E18|Wikipedia talk:Identifying reliable sources (medicine)]] expired 2021-07-31 18:01 ===
* Id: 1E16E18
* User: Mikehawk10 
* Date: 2021-06-29 14:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1031055241|SCI 1031055241}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1031055246|POLICY 1031055246}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1031055248|PROP 1031055248}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1036462019|SCI 1036462019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1036462026|POLICY 1036462026}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1036462031|PROP 1036462031}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the lead of [[WP:MEDRS]] begin?

*'''Option 1:''' {{tq| Wikipedia's articles are [[Wikipedia:Medical disclaimer|not meant to provide medical advice]]. Nevertheless, they are widely used among those seeking health information.<ref>{{cite journal | vauthors = Laurent MR, Vickers TJ | title = Seeking health information online: does Wikipedia matter? | journal = Journal of the American Medical Informatics Association | volume = 16 | issue = 4 | pages = 471‚Äì9 | year = 2009 | pmid = 19390105 | pmc = 2705249 | doi = 10.1197/jamia.M3059 | authorlink2 = User:TimVickers }}</ref> For this reason, all [[Wikipedia:Biomedical information|biomedical information]] must be based on reliable, [[Wikipedia:Third-party sources|third-party]] published [[secondary source]]s, and must accurately reflect current knowledge...}} (''Status quo'' prior to 9 June 2021)
*'''Option 2:''' {{tq|[[Wikipedia:Biomedical information|Biomedical information]] must be based on reliable, [[third-party]] published [[secondary source]]s, and must accurately reflect current knowledge.}} (Modified version inserted on 9 June 2021) ‚Äî [[User:Mikehawk10|Mikehawk10]] ([[User talk:Mikehawk10 |talk]]) 14:20, 29 June 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_EC07E8C|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-07-31 21:01 ===
* Id: EC07E8C
* User: WMrapids
* Date: 2021-07-09 04:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1032709577|MEDIA 1032709577}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1032709585|POL 1032709585}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1032709587|SOC 1032709587}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1037695804|MEDIA 1037695804}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1037695808|POL 1037695808}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1037695813|SOC 1037695813}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hello all! While editing recent articles in Peruvian politics, especially regarding [[Pedro Castillo]] and the [[2021 Peruvian general election]], ''[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]]'' was encountered on multiple occasions. There are some interesting interviews and articles written by ''Jacobin'', though there has not been a clear consensus on the reliability of the magazine as a source.

Previous discussions with dedicated sections were held, with the oldest being seen [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_302#Jacobin|here on Archive 302]], while in [[Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_324#Jacobin|Archive 324]] users shared that the reliability of ''Jacobin'' was between generally reliable and no consensus/addtional considerations after reviewing discussions from Archive 302.

Since it appears that ''Jacobin'' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:WhatLinksHere/Jacobin_(magazine)&limit=500 has hundreds of links throughout the project], it is suggested that we determine the level of reliability of the source so it can be present on the [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Perennial sources]] page.

Options are as follows:

*'''Option 1:''' The source is recognized as being [[WP:GREL|generally reliable]].
*'''Option 2:''' There is [[Wikipedia:MREL|no consensus or additional considerations apply]].
*'''Option 3:''' The source is recognized as being [[Wikipedia:GUNREL|generally unreliable]] in most cases, though it can be used under certain circumstances.
*'''Option 4:''' The source is recognized as being not reliable at all and should be [[Wikipedia:Deprecated sources|deprecated]]

Thank you for taking the time to take a look at this!--[[User:WMrapids|WMrapids]] ([[User talk:WMrapids|talk]]) 04:16, 9 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Eoin √ì Broin#rfc_AD22020|Talk:Eoin √ì Broin]] expired 2021-08-01 02:01 ===
* Id: AD22020
* User: Jdaly81
* Date: 2021-07-02 01:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1031512883|HIST 1031512883}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1036516471|HIST 1036516471}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=

[[User:Theleekycauldron|theleekycauldron]] ([[User talk:Theleekycauldron|talk]] ‚Ä¢ [[Special:Contributions/Theleekycauldron|contribs]]) ([[Singular they|they/them]]) 05:14, 6 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Battle of Saragarhi#rfc_ADC986F|Talk:Battle of Saragarhi]] expired 2021-08-06 09:01 ===
* Id: ADC986F
* User: Cinderella157
* Date: 2021-07-07 08:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1032417129|HIST 1032417129}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1037395771|HIST 1037395771}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An RfC is being made to determine the scope and primary topic of the article.

This article currently deals with the engagement at Fort Saragarhi on 12 September 1897 in which 21 Sikh troops fought a last-stand battle against Afghans.

There were six forts around Fort Lockhart on the Samana Ridge (including Fort Saragarhi). They were spread over about 5 miles.  They were engaged by Afghans from about 28 August until 14 September [https://books.google.com/books?id=SAGzBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA20] (see also discussion above and article).

The current article makes passing comment about other engagements in the vicinity in the "Background" and "Aftermath" sections.

A position presented in preceding discussion is that all of the engagements occurring around this time are part of the "Battle of Saragarhi".  Consequently, the article would need to be rewritten to reflect a broadened scope and revised primary topic, which is not just the engagement at Saragarhi.

'''There are two questions (options):'''
#Should the status quo be retained with the present scope and primary topic being the engagement at Saragarhi on 12 September 1897?
#Should the scope and primary topic of the "Battle of Saragarhi" article be expanded to include other engagements in the Samana Ridge area between about 28 August to 14 September?
[[User:Cinderella157|Cinderella157]] ([[User talk:Cinderella157|talk]]) 08:22, 7 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (WMF)#rfc_E116E78|Wikipedia:Village pump (WMF)]] expired 2021-08-06 19:01 ===
* Id: E116E78
* User: Alsee
* Date: 2021-08-06 03:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1037366649|PROP 1037366649}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1037468555|PROP 1037468555}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The issue of IP editing has long been a [[WP:Perennial_proposals#Prohibit_anonymous_users_from_editing|Perennial proposal]]. However circumstances have changed, with further major change on the way. Discussions on two unrelated issues both appear to indicate a shift in consensus against logged-out editing, and Portuguese Wikipedia has recently had positive results from prohibiting logged out edits completely. This RFC reports on these issues, and considers several options. [[User:Alsee|Alsee]] ([[User talk:Alsee|talk]]) 03:32, 6 August 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:In the news#rfc_9AF69A0|Wikipedia talk:In the news]] expired 2021-08-07 01:01 ===
* Id: 9AF69A0
* User: LaserLegs
* Date: 2021-07-08 00:20:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1032638281|POLICY 1032638281}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1037509417|POLICY 1037509417}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Suggest removing the '''Major figures''' criteria from [[Wikipedia:In_the_news/Recent_deaths#Blurbs_for_recent_deaths]]. It's a silly carry-over from when every death needed justification. There is no difference between a blurb or RD for a death except that a blurb pushes another item out of the box. If a person is truly a major figure, then they'd qualify for a blurb due to the "newsworthy reaction" to their passing as per '''Death as the main story'''. Lets clean up this artifact of the past, and end the needless blurb bickering. --[[User:LaserLegs|LaserLegs]] ([[User talk:LaserLegs|talk]]) 00:20, 8 July 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Did you know#rfc_F66982D|Wikipedia talk:Did you know]] expired 2021-08-09 02:01 ===
* Id: F66982D
* Date: 2021-08-04 18:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1037140536|PROJ 1037140536}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1043407545|PROJ 1043407545}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''''Did you know ...''' that articles nominated for [[WP:Did You Know]] often wait months for approval?''

Editors nominating an article for ''Did You Know'' generally must review someone else's nomination; this is called the QPQ (''[[quid pro quo]]''). But because new DYKers are allowed to make up to five nominations exempt from this requirement, there are always slightly more nominations coming in than reviews being performed, and over the years a large backlog has accumulated.

To reduce this backlog, so that nominations can be reviewed more promptly, DYK regulars have !voted to change the [[WP:Did_you_know#Review_requirement|rules for DYK's review requirement]]. Those rules currently provide
:''If, at the time a nomination is promoted to the main page, its nominator has fewer than 5 DYK credits (whether or not self-nominated) then the nomination is exempt from QPQ.''
The proposal is to substitute this text:
:''At the time a nomination is promoted to the main page''{{nbsp}}...
:* ''(a) if the nominator has fewer than 5 credits (whether or not self-nominated), no QPQ is required;''
:* ''(b) if the nominator has at least 5 credits but fewer than 20 credits, the nominator must do one QPQ;''
:* ''(c) if the nominator has 20 or more credits, the nominator must do two QPQs (if there's a backlog) or one QPQ (if not).''

Note: The above text is the result of extensive discussion [[#EEng's_alternative_for_addressing/preventing_the_unapproved_backlog|above]]. 18:43, 4 August 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography#rfc_06FA548|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Biography]] expired 2021-08-09 11:01 ===
* Id: 06FA548
* User: GoodDay
* Date: 2021-07-23 18:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1035112476|BIO 1035112476}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1035112488|POL 1035112488}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1035472784|STYLE 1035472784}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1040120579|BIO 1040120579}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1040120590|POL 1040120590}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1040120600|STYLE 1040120600}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Very straight forward & simple question. Should we <br> A) Keep the titles capitalized in the infoboxes or <br> B) Decapitalize in the infoboxes.

Examples-A: '''46th President of the United States''', '''23rd Prime Minister of Canada''' <br>
Examples-B  '''46th president of the United States''', '''23rd prime minister of Canada''' <br>

NOTE: This is about the infoboxes 'only' & naturally, will affect hundreds of bios. <br>
[[User:GoodDay|GoodDay]] ([[User talk:GoodDay|talk]]) 18:45, 23 July 2021 (UTC)}}

* Id: 17C2A82
* User: 188.27.36.191
* Date: 2021-08-12 18:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1038469345|HIST 1038469345}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
Seems like there is constant talk about a subset of the "White genocide conspiracy theory" that refers to "White replacement conspiracy theory".  This specific subtopic has been covered multiple times in mainstream sources, [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/11/opinion/tucker-carlson-white-replacement.html TNY], [https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/09/us/tucker-carlson-adl-replacement-theory.html NYT], [https://edition.cnn.com/2021/04/15/politics/scott-perry-white-replacement-theory-tucker-carlson-fox-news/index.html CNN] [https://www.theguardian.com/media/2021/apr/13/tucker-carlson-fox-news-murdoch-anti-defamation-league Guardian], [https://nymag.com/intelligencer/2021/04/tucker-carlson-great-replacement-white-supremacist-immigration-fox-news-racism.html NyMag] and considering the realities of widely available census data, it probably needs some concrete coverage distinct from the perspective "oh no it totally doesn't happen". [[Special:Contributions/188.27.36.191|188.27.36.191]] ([[User talk:188.27.36.191|talk]]) 18:51, 12 August 2021 (UTC)}}

[[List of chairmen of the State Bank of India]]
