* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
Hi! I'm making a second RfC as it seems the first one has resulted in clear consensus that her trans-related views deserve mention in the lead, but not the lead sentence. Below I have written a few possible ways to do so (in vague terms). Feel free to suggest other ways as well.
 
:'''A:''' Leave as is. Namely: Since late 2019, Rowling has publicly voiced her opinions on [[Politics of J. K. Rowling#Transgender people|transgender people and related civil rights]]. These views have been criticised as [[Transphobia|transphobic]] by [[LGBT rights]] organisations and some [[Feminism|feminists]], but have received support from some other feminists and individuals.
:'''B:''' Since 2019, Rowling has received significant attention for her views on [[Politics_of_J._K._Rowling#Transgender_people|transgender people and related civil rights]]. These views have been widely criticized as [[transphobia|transphobic]] in mainstream media and mainstream [[feminism]], yet has received support from [[TERF|trans-exclusionary radical feminists]], some artists, and a few [[Conservative politics|conservative politicians]].
:'''C:''' Since 2019, coverage of Rowling's views on [[Politics_of_J._K._Rowling#Transgender_people|transgender people and related civil rights]] has gained increasing prominence in the media. Her views, published on social media and her personal website, have been widely criticized as [[transphobia|transphobic]] in mainstream media and mainstream [[feminism]], yet have received support from [[TERF|trans-exclusionary radical feminists]], some artists, and a few [[Conservative politics|conservative politicians]].
:'''D:''' Leave it out of the lead completely.
:'''E:''' Include in the lead section, with other language to be determined later.
:'''F:''' Other. Please propose an alternative if you do vote this option.
[[User:A. C. Santacruz|A. C. Santacruz]] ([[User talk:A. C. Santacruz|talk]]) 13:57, 26 November 2021 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
 This Italian-language news website ([http://www.lavocedellevoci.it/]), although sells conspiracy theories ([https://www.thestandnews.com/politics/%E5%AF%A6%E9%8C%98%E4%B8%AD%E5%85%B1%E7%9A%84%E8%85%B3%E5%B7%B2%E8%A2%AB%E5%AE%98%E5%AA%92%E6%90%AC%E7%9A%84%E7%9F%B3%E9%A0%AD%E7%A0%B8%E7%88%9B%E4%BA%86] {{In lang|zh}}), and I had asked that it be deprecated (cf. [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 359]]), no other Wikipedians responded, meaning this website is still not deprecated, despite some articles use it as a "credible" source (e.g. [[Camouflage passport]] & [[International Parliament for Safety and Peace]]). In here I made the same proposal again. Hope that Wikipedians who are proficient at both Italian and Chinese can verify my claim that it is unreliable thus should be deprecated and discuss whether or not to deprecate it. Thanks!üòÅ--[[User:RekishiEJ|RekishiEJ]] ([[User talk:RekishiEJ|talk]]) 15:10, 30 November 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_BA9ECAD|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-12-28 22:01 ===
* Id: BA9ECAD
* User: Unknown Temptation
* Date: 2021-12-28 20:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1062498755|PROP 1062498755}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1062507709|PROP 1062507709}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As somebody who has written on many subjects outside the English-speaking world but who lives in the English-speaking world, I see many websites like the Teller Report in my search results. These websites Google Translate major news websites from the rest of the world. The articles are 1) often incomprehensible and 2) violate copyright. Teller Report is cited on many pages: [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Search&limit=500&offset=0&profile=default&search=tellerreport.com&ns0=1]. It is my opinion that there is no room for negotiation here: this site must be blacklisted for 1) copyright violation and 2) not being written or edited by humans. I found on [[Ralf Rangnick]] that a Teller Report page [https://www.tellerreport.com/news/2019-07-10---ralf-rangnick--%22i-am-one-of-the-greatest-romantics%22-.ryMCpV7bS.html had been removed on request] from the German newspaper Zeit. For those unfamiliar with the Teller Report's content and quality, here is a story from today which even copied the image from RT: [https://www.tellerreport.com/news/2021-12-28-zhirinovsky-proposed-to-increase-the-holidays-of-russians-at-the-expense-of-holidays.rJfNOkG_oK.html "Zhirinovsky proposed to '''increase the holidays''' of Russians '''at the expense of holidays'''"] [[User:Unknown Temptation|Unknown Temptation]] ([[User talk:Unknown Temptation|talk]]) 20:16, 28 December 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_DC65431|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-12-28 22:01 ===
* Id: DC65431
* User: Bsslover371
* Date: 2021-12-28 01:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1062369645|PROP 1062369645}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1062507709|PROP 1062507709}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Common Sense Media is a San Francisco-based non-profit organization that provides education and advocacy to families to promote safe technology and media for children. It reviews entertainment in terms of age-appropriate educational content, and it has also developed a set of ratings that are intended to gauge the educational value of videos, games, and apps.

But I think [[Common Sense Media]] is unreliable for the following reasons. I used rottenwebsites.miraheze.org/wiki/Common_Sense_Media which has a page on the wiki.
#They are too gullible about lessons, believing that every media influences children. For example, on their [[Teen Titans Go!]] review they gave it a 3/5 in teaching positive messages, and they gave [[13 Reasons Why]] a 4/5 due to the show supporting suicide.
#As an advocate for education, they pander towards educational shows and they are biased against shows that entertain, such as Spongebob SquarePants.
#They pander towards [[social justice warriors]], meaning the source is ideologically biased and they pander towards media supporting their ideology. For example, they entirely neglect content containing sexual violence against men.[[User:Bsslover371|Bsslover371]] ([[User talk:Bsslover371|talk]]) 01:27, 28 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nathan Edmondson#rfc_D240EFC|Talk:Nathan Edmondson]] expired 2021-12-30 02:01 ===
* Id: D240EFC
* User: Aquillion
* Date: 2021-11-30 01:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1054198199|BIO 1054198199}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1054198209|MEDIA 1054198209}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1062709000|BIO 1062709000}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1062709007|MEDIA 1062709007}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been a protracted dispute over whether to include or exclude the following things on this article:

1. Should the article mention the arrest for credit card fraud, most recently summarized in the first paragraph [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nathan_Edmondson&oldid=1057797735#Legal_issues_and_controversy here]?

2. Should the article mention the allegations of sexual harassment, most recently summarized in the second paragraph [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nathan_Edmondson&oldid=1057797735#Legal_issues_and_controversy here]?

3. Should the article mention the controversy over his work, most recently summarized [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Nathan_Edmondson&diff=1049710606&oldid=1049710472 here]?

Please indicate each separately (unless you have the same opinion on all three or something), with any details for how you'd prefer to cover them relative to the current / most recent versions. --[[User:Aquillion|Aquillion]] ([[User talk:Aquillion|talk]]) 01:14, 30 November 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_09FCFC8|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-12-30 16:01 ===
* Id: 09FCFC8
* User: WMrapids
* Date: 2021-12-02 06:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1058229113|MEDIA 1058229113}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1058229115|POL 1058229115}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1063107599|MEDIA 1063107599}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1063107603|POL 1063107603}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Due to the complexity related to [[WP:PIA]], should there be there be changes to the [[WP:RSP]] listing of ''Politico'' similar to [[Fox News]] and [[Newsweek]]?

Below are a few proposals:

*'''Proposal 1:''' Create a note of a potential bias with current listing
*'''Proposal 2:''' Create a listing similar to the [[WP:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_303#RfC:_Fox_News|current Fox News listing]] specifically for Israel-Palestine topics, e.g. {{highlight|[[WP:GREL]] ''Politico'' (American politics)|#ddffdd}} and {{highlight|[[WP:MREL]] ''Politico'' (Israel-Palestine topics)|#ffffdd}}
*'''Proposal 3:''' Create a listing similar to the [[WP:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 280|current Newsweek listing]] for the overall reliability of ''Politico'', e.g. {{highlight|[[WP:GREL]] ''Politico'' (pre-2021)|#ddffdd}} and {{highlight|[[WP:MREL]] ''Politico'' (2021‚Äìpresent)|#ffffdd}}

Thanks for any support or comments ahead of time!--[[User:WMrapids|WMrapids]] ([[User talk:WMrapids|talk]]) 06:34, 2 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Chembox#rfc_722DAF0|Template talk:Chembox]] expired 2021-12-31 12:01 ===
* Id: 722DAF0
* User: Klein Mu√ßi
* Date: 2021-12-01 11:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1058092845|TECH 1058092845}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1062960680|TECH 1062960680}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
After 2 current discussions ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Chembox&oldid=1059765405#Lua_rewrite Lua rewrite] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template_talk:Chembox&oldid=1059765405#Convert_Chembox_into_Lua_module Convert Chembox into Lua module]) and some other discussions in the past years (they're mentioned in the discussions above and are part of the the archives) this is the first formal RfC that is being opened on the subject.

My proposal:

# Make {{tl|Chembox}}, a de facto infobox, a de jure one by changing the name;
# Luaficate its wikitext structure to lower the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:PrefixIndex?prefix=Chembox&namespace=10 vast number of its subpages];

The subject has been locally discussed some times but usually it has failed to acquire a large number of users involved so now we're trying the RfC way. - [[User:Klein Mu√ßi|Klein Mu√ßi]] ([[User talk:Klein Mu√ßi|talk]]) 11:58, 1 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Criticism of Sikhism#rfc_7D23D90|Talk:Criticism of Sikhism]] expired 2021-12-31 15:01 ===
* Id: 7D23D90
* User: TrangaBellam
* Date: 2021-12-01 14:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1058113131|RELI 1058113131}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1058120702|HIST 1058120702}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1062980206|HIST 1062980206}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1062980210|RELI 1062980210}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Are the following paragraphs sourced to John Robson, considerable as {{tq|criticism of Sikhism}} and more particularly, {{tq|Sikh practice of biblolatry}}?
{{talkquote|Govind Singh at his death did not appoint any guru to succeed him, but told them to look to the ''Granth'', to which he had added a supplement, as their guru. This has led to what is the most marked feature of the Sikh religion ‚Äî Bibliolatry. ''Sri Granth'', the honourable Book, is the object of worship in all Sikh temples. It is dressed in expensive cloth, laid carefully in its bed at night, like one of the Hindu idols, and when brought out, receives divine worship before it is read. Next to the ''Granth'' the ''Guru'' or master is honoured, and he has great power over his disciples. In doctrine they are not very different from the Vaishnavas; in morality, except in soldierly virtues, they are said to be even below the average Hindus. They are divided into twelve sects, some of which are relapsing into image worship, and in process of time it is not unlikely that they will all take their place in the ranks of all-absorbing Hinduism.{{pb}}Meanwhile Sikhism may fairly claim to be a distinct religion; and it is remarkable as being the only eclectic creed which has ever become the religion of a large body of disciples, and welded them into a nation. Even it proves the rule. It is not its eclectic creed which gives Sikhism its power over its followers, but the sectarian and patriotic dogmas inculcated by Govind. These gave it power so long as the power of fighting and of conquest remained. But now that it is lost, and it has only its eclecticism and bibliolatry to fall back on, it seems to have lost its expansiveness, and is increasing only with the increase of the population.|source={{Cite book|last=Robson|first=John|url=http://archive.org/details/hinduismandchri00unkngoog|title=Hinduism and Christianity|publisher=Oxford University|p=158-159|year=1905}}}} [[User:TrangaBellam|TrangaBellam]] ([[User talk:TrangaBellam|talk]]) 14:50, 1 December 2021 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Criticism of Sikhism#rfc_F8D2CE6|Talk:Criticism of Sikhism]] expired 2021-12-31 15:01 ===
* Id: F8D2CE6
* User: TrangaBellam
* Date: 2021-12-01 14:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1058120702|HIST 1058120702}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1058120718|RELI 1058120718}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1062980206|HIST 1062980206}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1062980210|RELI 1062980210}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is the following paragraph sourced to [[J. N. Farquhar]], considerable as {{tq|criticism of Sikhism}} ?
*{{talkquote|The tragedy in the history of these sects which, under the influence of Islam, gave up Hindu worship, is that they have been unable to find a satisfactory substitute for it. The mere reading of pieces of vernacular poetry and the singing of hymns does not grip the common people. Those sects which restrict themselves to that tend to lose their hold on the laity, while the rest revert to Hindu guru-worship, as the Kabirpanthis have done, or fall to bibliolatry, as is the case with the Sikhs and the Dadupanthis.|source={{Cite book|last=Farquhar|first=John Nicol|url=http://archive.org/details/outlineofreligio00farqrich|title=An outline of the religious literature of India|date=1920|publisher=Oxford university Press|page=346}}}} [[User:TrangaBellam|TrangaBellam]] ([[User talk:TrangaBellam|talk]]) 14:30, 1 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Criticism of Sikhism#rfc_B55552B|Talk:Criticism of Sikhism]] expired 2021-12-31 16:01 ===
* Id: B55552B
* User: TrangaBellam
* Date: 2021-12-01 15:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1058128358|HIST 1058128358}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1058128361|RELI 1058128361}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1062987465|HIST 1062987465}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1062987469|RELI 1062987469}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is the following paragraph sourced to a book review, considerable as {{tq|criticism of Sikhism}} and more particularly, {{tq|Sikh practice of biblolatry}}?
{{talkquote|At the central shrine of the Sikhs at Amritsar, their sacred book the ''Granth'' is dressed every morning in rich brocade and placed on a throne, at night it is placed in a golden bed. This is Bibliolatry literal and supreme, it is fundamentalism in extremis. At the other end of the scale, the sacred books of Confucianism are not ‚Äòsacred‚Äô in the usual meaning of the term at all; they are more strictly ‚ÄòClassics.‚Äô Between these two positions, that of the Sikh and that of the Confucianist, there are many degrees illustrated by the attitude to their sacred books of Modernists, Hindus, Parsees, Mohammedans, Tennesseeans, etc. ''Revaluing Scripture'' is an account of these various attitudes and also a comparison of the world‚Äôs Bibles. It opens what is almost a new field of research and a very important one in view of the wide and well endowed [[Christian fundamentalism|fundamentalist movement]] in America today.|source={{Cite journal|last=Forster|first=A. Haire|date=July 1928|title=Book Review of "Revaluing Scripture" by Frank Eakin. Newyork: Macmillan, 1928, pp. 249. $ 2.25|journal=[[Anglican Theological Review]]|volume=11|pages=86|author-link=Arthur Haire-Forster}}}} [[User:TrangaBellam|TrangaBellam]] ([[User talk:TrangaBellam|talk]]) 15:06, 1 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Pakistan#rfc_6916168|Talk:Pakistan]] expired 2021-12-31 17:01 ===
* Id: 6916168
* User: Peter Ormond
* Date: 2021-12-01 17:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1058128358|HIST 1058128358}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1058160722|POL 1058160722}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1062995700|HIST 1062995700}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1062995706|POL 1062995706}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Pakistan claimed the former Princely States of Junagarh and Manavadar and the entire territory and water bodies that fall in the Sir Creek region in the westernmost part of India in its new political map released in 2020.<ref>{{Cite news|date=9 August 2020 |title=Why has Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan announced a new political map? |journal=The Hindu |url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/national/the-hindu-explains-why-has-pakistan-prime-minister-imran-khan-announced-a-new-political-map/article32306669.ece }}</ref>

The claiming of Junagarh and Manavadar is not new. See a [https://www.alamy.com/mail-postage-stamps-pakistan-6-paise-postage-stamp-1960-additional-rights-clearance-info-not-available-image241531252.html 1960 stamp], for example.

The [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Pakistan_(orthographic_projection).svg map on Commons] was updated accordingly to depict these "claimed regions". But there has been edit-warring, and a user has suggested to gain consensus for the change.

So, should we add these "claimed regions" to the map? <span style="font-family:'Linux Libertine','Georgia','Times',serif">'''[[User:Peter Ormond|<span style="color:#113680"> Peter Ormond </span>]][[User talk:Peter Ormond|<span style="background:#d9cc6c; color:white; padding:2px;">&#128172;</span>]]'''</span> 17:00, 1 December 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Featured article criteria#rfc_0ED1AF4|Wikipedia talk:Featured article criteria]] expired 2021-01-02 22:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
I hope to resolve an editing disagreement. It‚Äôs about [[Wikipedia:Featured article criteria|FA criterion 2.c.]], which says that a featured article: {{bq|follows the [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style|style guidelines]], including .&nbsp;.&nbsp;. '''consistent citations''': where required by criterion 1c, consistently formatted inline citations using footnotes  <small>(<nowiki><ref>Smith 2007, p. 1</ref></nowiki>)</small>‚Äîsee [[Wikipedia:Citing sources|citing sources]] for suggestions on formatting references. Citation templates are not required.}} 

Does this mean that every citation in an FA must either include the place of publication, or else every one must omit it?&nbsp;‚Äî''[[user:Mzajac|Michael]]&nbsp;[[user_talk:Mzajac|Z]].'' 21:03, 3 December 2020 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the ethnicity and nationality dimensions of the term [[Germans]] be weighted on Wikipedia?
*Create two separate pages for Germans and Ethnic Germans, perhaps with a disambiguation page linking to both
*Rewrite the article as a [[Wikipedia:Broad-concept article|broad concept article]]
*Tweak the lead of [[Germans]] to mention the overlapping but distinct usages (e.g. [[Special:Diff/989353630|as in this edit]])
*Leave the article as is
--[[User:Tserton|Tserton]] ([[User talk:Tserton|talk]]) 00:26, 5 December 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Exploitation of labour#rfc_6BA1CE4|Talk:Exploitation of labour]] expired 2021-01-05 05:01 ===
* Id: 6BA1CE4
* User: Vallee01
* Date: 2020-12-25 18:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|996307689|RELI 996307689}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|998392664|RELI 998392664}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article by user {{u|BunnyyHop}} has text that reads mostly straight out of an ML manifesto or an argumentative essay. It at one "The exploitation of man and nature are also linked at the level of consciousness. The mystification of wages forms a basis for the [[Trinitarian formula]]. One aspect of this formula is that man perceives the soil in a mystified way. It appears as if the soil is an independent source of value" followed by: ''"Exploitation of man and exploitation of nature go hand in hand. Thus Marx states in the first volume of Capital that every advance in capitalist agriculture is 'not only an advance in the art of robbing the worker, but at the same time in the art of robbing the soil, every advance in increasing its fertility for a given period of time is at the same time an advance in ruining the permanent sources of this fertility. [...] Capitalist production develops [...] only the technique and combination of the social process of production, undermining at the same time the springing sources of all wealth: the soil and the worker."'' He believes that I am filibustering despite all of his edits being extremely POV pushing. It is extremely obvious so I am making this RfC request. [[User:Vallee01|&#91;&#91;user:Vallee&#124;Des Vallee&#93;&#93;]] ([[User talk:Vallee01|talk]]) 18:59, 25 December 2020 (UTC)}}

Should the noun "Washington Football Team" be used with singular verbs or plural verbs? Examples of each have been given below:
*'''Singular verb''' The Washington Football Team '''is''' a professional American football team based in the Washington metropolitan area.
*'''Plural verb''' The Washington Football Team '''are''' a professional American football team based in the Washington metropolitan area.

=== [[Template talk:R to project namespace#rfc_8EFD160|Template talk:R to project namespace]] expired 2021-01-05 06:01 ===
* Id: 8EFD160
* User: SMcCandlish
* Date: 2020-12-24 19:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|996142122|POLICY 996142122}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|996142126|TECH 996142126}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|998401176|POLICY 998401176}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|998401181|TECH 998401181}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We presently have {{tnull|R to {{var|foo}} namespace}} templates for categorizing redirects, for maintenance purposes.  These templates are presently documented as intended for use a) on cross-namespace redirects (e.g. {{tlx|R to project namespace}} goes on [[MOS:CAPS]], a shortcut in a "MOS:" pseudo-namespace that is really a mainspace page); and b) on within-same-namespace redirects (e.g., put that same {{tnull|R to project namespace}} on [[WP:MOSCAPS]], which is already in the same "Wikipedia:" namespace as the target page of the both WP:MOSCAPS and MOS:CAPS).

Presently the documentation on whether to do this is inconsistent.  {{tlx|R to main namespace}}, {{tlx|R to template namespace}}, {{tlx|R to user namespace}}, {{tlx|R to category namespace}}, and {{tlx|R to draft namespace}} are only for cross-namespace redirects.  {{tlx|R to talk page}} is a variant of this, in being for redirects to any talk namespace from any non-talk namespace, but not for redirects within a talk namespace or between one talk namespace and another.  Only {{tlx|R to project namespace}}, {{tlx|R to portal namespace}}, and {{tlx|R to help namespace}} say to use them also for redirects within the same namespace.

'''Which of the following is preferable?'''
# Apply such templates only to cross-namespace redirects.
# Apply such templates also to same-namespace redirects.
# Different for different cases (please specify, with rationales).

I'm RfCing this because there has been sporadic argument about this for several years, without resolution. Notices about this RfC have been posted to all the relevant talk pages I could think of. <span style="white-space:nowrap;font-family:'Trebuchet MS'">‚Äâ‚Äî‚ÄØ[[User:SMcCandlish|'''SMcCandlish''']] [[User talk:SMcCandlish|‚òè]] [[Special:Contributions/SMcCandlish|¬¢]]‚ÄÉüòº‚ÄÉ</span> 19:07, 24 December 2020 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Merging#rfc_C0362C8|Wikipedia talk:Merging]] expired 2021-01-05 06:01 ===
* Id: C0362C8
* User: Mdewman6
* Date: 2020-12-13 23:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|994073916|POLICY 994073916}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should there be procedures for proposing potentially controversial [[WP:BLAR|blank and redirects]] that are analogous to those for proposing [[WP:merge|page merges]]? [[User:Mdewman6|Mdewman6]] ([[User talk:Mdewman6|talk]]) 23:17, 13 December 2020 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia talk:Revert only when necessary#rfc_CDE8550|Wikipedia talk:Revert only when necessary]] expired 2021-01-05 06:01 ===
* Id: CDE8550
* User: Isaac Rabinovitch
* Date: 2020-12-10 03:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|993351555|POLICY 993351555}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|993351560|TECH 993351560}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|998401176|POLICY 998401176}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|998401181|TECH 998401181}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
If my experience is anything to go by, most reverts do not follow the guidelines on this page. I've been reverted without inadequate explanation or no explanation at all. When I make changes, designed to make the text clear or less misleading, I might be reverted by somebody who likes the old version better. I've even been reverted for failing to provide a citation.

I do realize that this page is an essay, not policy. But it would still be helpful if reverters were forced to consider these ideas. In any case, reversion needs to be a lot less impulsive.

To accomplish this, I propose these software changes:

# Instead of simply telling editors that revert comments are required, refuse to accept reverts without one.
# Provide a message about limiting use of reverts, with links to [[WP:OWN]] and/or [[WP:RV]].
# Force the editor to acknowledge these issues by checking a box to indicate that they're sure that reversion, instead of editing or discussion, is the right thing to do. Admins would be exempt, to make their vandalism cleanup less onerous.

[[User:Isaac Rabinovitch|Isaac Rabinovitch]] ([[User talk:Isaac Rabinovitch|talk]]) 03:16, 10 December 2020 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
{{User:ClueBot III/DoNotArchiveUntil|1614792571}}
''' Support split '''- To follow up on the previous discussion, since there is consensus to split, I suggest reducing the "Reactions", "Impact", "Local media coverage", "Police misconduct", "Online confrontations", "Deaths", "Background", "History" as well as the "Clashes between protesters and counter-protesters" sections to ONE paragraph each, and having the rest covered in the sub articles.  Obviously, I am open to suggestions.  Splitting by year will only help so much, as there are now sections for each month. --[[User:Jax 0677|Jax 0677]] ([[User talk:Jax 0677|talk]]) 17:17, 27 December 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Atintanians#rfc_05C0B1E|Talk:Atintanians]] expired 2021-01-06 03:01 ===
* Id: 05C0B1E
* User: Khirurg
* Date: 2020-12-07 02:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|992790182|HIST 992790182}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|992790184|LANG 992790184}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|998591952|HIST 998591952}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|998591956|LANG 998591956}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article's lede be changed from the stable version {{tq|'''Atintanes or Atintanians (Greek: ·ºàœÑŒπŒΩœÑŒ¨ŒΩŒµœÇ, Atint√°nes, Latin: Atintanii) was an ancient tribe in Epirus. They inhabited a region inland of the Epirote coast which was called Atintania. They were one of the Epirote tribes that belonged to the northwestern Greek group. [...] and spoke a northwestern Greek dialect similar to Doric Greek.'''}} to either of the following options. 

OPTION A
:{{tq|'''The Atintanes or Atintanians (Ancient Greek: ·ºàœÑŒπŒΩœÑŒ¨ŒΩŒµœÇ, Atint√°nes, Latin: Atintanii) were an ancient tribe in the borderlands between [[Epirus]] and [[Illyria]]. They inhabited an inland region which was called Atintania. They have been described as either an Epirote tribe belonging to the northwestern Greek group or an Illyrian tribe. According to older sources, the tribe spoke an [[Illyrian languages|Illyrian]] dialect, while today there is an overall consensus in scholarship that they spoke a [[northwestern Greek]] dialect similar to [[Doric Greek]].'''}}
OPTION B
:{{tq|'''The Atintanes or Atintanians (Ancient Greek: ·ºàœÑŒπŒΩœÑŒ¨ŒΩŒµœÇ, Atint√°nes, Latin: Atintanii) were an ancient tribe in the borderlands between [[Illyria]] and [[Epirus]]. They inhabited an inland region which was called Atintania. They have been described as either an Illyrian tribe that spoke a language similar to other southern Illyrian tribes or as Epirote tribe that belonged to the [[northwestern Greek]] group and spoke [[Doric Greek]].'''}}

[[User:Khirurg|Khirurg]] ([[User talk:Khirurg|talk]]) 02:12, 7 December 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:European theatre of World War II#rfc_D7CBBC3|Talk:European theatre of World War II]] expired 2021-01-07 12:01 ===
* Id: D7CBBC3
* User: Ïõ¨ÎîîÎü¨ÎπÑ
* Date: 2021-01-06 05:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|998671806|HIST 998671806}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|998873495|HIST 998873495}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I think we should make criteria to make belligerents clearly. It is too difficult and vague, because it contains too much information in one template. We can just add "co-belligerents" as Allies of WW2, (we can change that name) or we can make this template as simplest as [[Pacific War]] template, which put participants articles independently. We don't have to add all belligerents. I also do not prefer describing some specific belligerents such as Soviet Union in [[Invasion of Poland]] whose statue as Axis was controversial at 1939 to 1941, or Finland which describes as co-belligerent which is contradict to other articles. (see [[Operation Barbarossa]], [[Siege of Leningrad]], [[Vyborg‚ÄìPetrozavodsk Offensive]] which is "NOT" described Finland as co-belligerent). -- [[User:Ïõ¨ÎîîÎü¨ÎπÑ|Wendylove]] ([[User talk:Ïõ¨ÎîîÎü¨ÎπÑ|talk]]) 05:41, 6 January 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fidesz#rfc_0FDF826|Talk:Fidesz]] expired 2021-01-07 15:01 ===
* Id: 0FDF826
* User: Helper201
* Date: 2020-12-08 14:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|993058602|POL 993058602}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|998896682|POL 998896682}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Two separated points I'd like to highlight here. First, authoritarianism is being removed from the infobox without reason despite being supported by multiple citations and there is no consensus not to include it in the infobox.

On the second, separate point, we should not include only one of the two cited political positions in the infobox in the lead. Both right-wing and far-right are cited with multiple citations in the infobox. Either we include both of the cited positions in the lead or neither. To only include one position in the lead gives unnecessary weight to one position over the other. To keep as [[WP:NEUTRAL|neutral]] as possible we should include both cited positions or neither, not give unnecessary and undue weight in any particular direction. [[User:Helper201|Helper201]] ([[User talk:Helper201|talk]]) 14:51, 8 December 2020 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:The Pleasure Garden (1925 film)#rfc_88F7E6E|Talk:The Pleasure Garden (1925 film)]] expired 2021-01-08 06:01 ===
* Id: 88F7E6E
* User: PDMagazineCoverUploading
* Date: 2021-01-05 08:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|998929479|POL 998929479}}

{{rfcquote|text=
All works published in 1925 entered the public domain in the United States on January 1. Per {{Ping|Vegan4Life}}, [https://www.brentonfilm.com/articles/alfred-hitchcock-collectors-guide-the-pleasure-garden-1925 sources] are claiming ''The Pleasure Garden'' is copyrighted until 1 Jan 2023 due to it not being released in the UK until 1927. [http://www.acinemahistory.com/2016/11/the-pleasure-garden-1925_5.html However, it was released in Germany in 1925], albeit under a different title. I won't revert as IANAL but I think we should come to a consensus on this. Does ''The Pleasure Garden'' count as being released in 1925 due to its showing in Germany, or do we wait until 2023 for the 1927 date? [[User:PDMagazineCoverUploading|PDMagazineCoverUploading]] ([[User talk:PDMagazineCoverUploading|talk]]) 08:18, 5 January 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_55995AB|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-01-09 16:01 ===
* Id: 55995AB
* User: Pasdecomplot
* Date: 2021-01-09 14:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|999310155|PROP 999310155}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|999319247|PROP 999319247}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
CCTV is a distinctly depreciated source, as the community decided per a RfC Archive 312 in September 2020 [https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_312#RFC:_China_Global_Television_Network here].

Exceptional claims via CCTV were deleted in good faith [diff] then readded. Inline citations to CCTV were then added in good faith [diff], per policy on adding contentious information on living persons. Those were reverted [diff] and characterized as "disruptive" [diff].

At issue is the exceptional CCTV claims (read ridiculous) were used in RS during the 2008 Tibetan uprising anniversary, or in the 'heat of the moment'.

This is a RfC on requiring inline citation of CCTV in such instances. If in these instances the depreciated status of CCTV allows for the deletion of edits sourcing CCTV indirectly, clarification is welcome. It's also requested that only uninvolved editors/admins comment. [[User:Pasdecomplot|Pasdecomplot]] ([[User talk:Pasdecomplot|talk]]) 14:32, 9 January 2021 (UTC)}}

Should infobox have "country= " be constant across all school pages on Wikipedia, as there are currently over 10 variations that I have found for just the school pages alone. Some variations I have seen are: <nowiki> [[United States]] [[United States of America]] [[USA]] [[US]] [[U.S.]] [[United States|U.S.]] [[United States of America|USA]] as well as some of the same variations without linking brackets.</nowiki> The questions is, Should the "country=" be U.S. on every school page? Thanks, [[User:Darkskynet|Darkskynet]] ([[User talk:Darkskynet#top|talk]]) 18:06, 9 January 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Steven M. Paul#rfc_314E663|Talk:Steven M. Paul]] expired 2021-01-10 10:01 ===

COI disclaimer: I am a colleague of Steven M.  Paul. My proposed edits to the Steven M Paul page is to provide accurate and up-to-date information. I have declared this COI on my User page. If there are ever any concerns about my contributions, please let me know.‚Ä©

	Steven M. Paul is an American neuroscientist and pharmaceutical executive. === [[Talk:Antifa (United States)#rfc_4C59DB5|Talk:Antifa (United States)]] expired 2021-01-11 21:01 ===

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 I wish to have all references to antifa as "left-wing" changed to "far-left" or "radical-left". Bellow I have 5 left wing journal and proper academy sources claiming that Antifa is in fact a far-left ideology and for that should be properly labelled. If more proper academic sources are required I would happy to provide the appropriate point. I am not here looking for a fight, I just think this is an appropriate change. By not changing this you are making all left wing people including myself look look like we associate with Antifa, a violent organization.

https://www.cnn.com/2017/08/14/us/what-is-antifa-trnd/index.html 
"Antifa is short for anti-fascists. The term is used to define a broad group of people whose political beliefs lean toward the left ‚Äì often the far left"

"we found evidences supporting the Moral Foundations Theory among left- and right-wing extremists."

=== [[Talk:Pentagon UFO videos#rfc_B963E8C|Talk:Pentagon UFO videos]] expired 2021-01-12 03:01 ===
* Id: B963E8C
* User: Bigbaby23
* Date: 2021-01-07 09:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|998858663|SCI 998858663}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|998858673|POL 998858673}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|999816940|SCI 999816940}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|999816947|POL 999816947}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a dispute regarding the classification of Due Weight view in this article. This situation is quite unusual, because traditionaly it would be just 2 clear views: skeptics vs ufologists, and perhaps government denial

I categorizes the current views as 4:

View #1: U.S. Department of Defence - The UFO, after their investigation is officially classified as "unidentified".

View #2: UFO Skeptics - it is for sure, not "unidentified". Listing different mundane explanations.

View #3: UFO advocates - it is probable that it is of extraterrestrial origin. Listing different mundane observations analysis.

View #4 Inconclusive without more info - a call of both skeptics and Ufologists alike from the DOD to release all information for scientific critical inspection in order to reach a conclusion.


All 4 views are available from reliable sources (many times even the same source), so that is not an issue.

My view is that the DOD view is Prime, and should not be marginalized or create a misrepresentation of it's weight by either views #2 & #3. Currently the article section "possible explanations" is inappropriatly giving due weight to view #2 (via long quotations from skeptic Mick West) which contradicts and marginalize view #1. View #3 is not presented according to [[WP:FRINGE]].

This reverted edit, corrects the current article  per above
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Pentagon_UFO_videos&oldid=998819223

See also talk section "List of sources we could use" for detailed discussion regarding DOD position https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Pentagon_UFO_videos#List_of_sources_we_could_use

Currently the article is mostly edited and debated in the talk page by the same UFO Skeptics, who are pushing for view #2.
Hence a call for an RfC to uninvolved editors.
Do you agree with the above assessment and categorization? [[User:Bigbaby23|Bigbaby23]] ([[User talk:Bigbaby23|talk]]) 09:22, 7 January 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Schools#rfc_46DAD4F|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Schools]] expired 2021-01-12 14:01 ===
* Id: 46DAD4F
* User: Darkskynet
* Date: 2021-01-09 19:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|999715134|STYLE 999715134}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|999895095|STYLE 999895095}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should infobox have "country= " be constant across all school pages on Wikipedia, as there are currently over 10 variations that I have found for just the school pages alone. Some variations I have seen are: <nowiki> [[United States]] [[United States of America]] [[USA]] [[US]] [[U.S.]] [[United States|U.S.]] [[United States of America|USA]] as well as some of the same variations without linking brackets.</nowiki><br> '''The questions is; Should the "country=" be U.S. on every school page in the United States?''' Thanks, [[User:Darkskynet|Darkskynet]] ([[User talk:Darkskynet|talk]]) 19:59, 9 January 2021 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_10E2E2E|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2021-01-13 00:01 ===
* Id: 10E2E2E
* User: Tennishistory1877
* Date: 2021-01-12 10:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|999872941|HIST 999872941}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|999990452|HIST 999990452}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should self-published tennis sources be allowed as sources under wikipedia under the following rules?

Amazon published tennis books allowed as wikipedia sources under the following rules for minimum standards of entry (all standards listed must be met):

Publication has an Amazon Sales Rank in five different countries.

Publication reviewed or recommended by a tennis magazine or an established expert.

Publication accepted into the Kenneth Ritchie library at Wimbledon.

Author may not cite own work. 

[[User:Tennishistory1877|Tennishistory1877]] ([[User talk:Tennishistory1877|talk]]) 10:33, 12 January 2021 (UTC)}}
